etymology.description: 糸(糸) (mì, "string") + 木(木) (mù, "wood") = strings on a piece of wood -> wooden musical instrument
etymology.interpretation: The character 樂(樂) (lè, "music") originally represents strings attached to a wooden frame, depicting a musical instrument. The addition of 白(白) (bái) in bronze inscriptions likely represents either the thumb in playing motion or serves as a phonetic component. Over time, it became associated with music and by extension, happiness.

examples.chinese: 我喜歡聽樂(我喜歡聽樂)。
他在音樂會上欣賞樂(他在音樂會上欣賞樂)，感受文化魅力(感受文化魅力)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài yīnyuèhuì shàng xīnshǎng lè, gǎnshòu wénhuà mèilì.
examples.english: He appreciates music at the concert and experiences the charm of culture.

examples.chinese: 書房中傳來樂(書房中傳來樂)，令人心情愉悅(令人心情愉悅)。
examples.pinyin: Shūfáng zhōng chuán lái lè, lìngrén xīnqíng yúyuè.
examples.english: Music comes from the study, making people feel delighted.
